Map<TOTYPE>(Object, Boolean, MapContext)

Instantiates a TOTYPE as "to" and populates "to" with mapped values of "from". Any property that is the same position with the same name in the from and to simply directly maps or maps after a type casting. Either the type of the "to" or the type of "from" is considered the "cartographer" based on the isTheFromTypeTheCartographer parameter. The cartographer is the type that might contain mapping attributes ([Map], [Invoke]) and mapping methods that handle any mapping that is not directly from a propery of like position and name

There are three ways the map knows what to map

  1. There are mapping methods cooresponding to a cartographer's property (described below) that are invoked to do the mapping for that property
  2. There is a MatchAttribute on a cartographer property that names the property on the noncartographer type that it maps to
  3. The cartographer property maps to a property on the noncartographer type of the exact same name.

See Extensions.Test.ModelMapperTest for a simple example of all the major functionality of ModelMapper.

MAPPING METHODS To get map to invoke a mapping method, it must following all the following rules Rule 1) The method must be in the cartographer class Rule 2) It's name must be "To_" + NAME or "From_" + NAME or "Match_" + NAME where NAME = NAMEOFCARTOGRAPHERPROPERTYTOMAP [(optionally) + "" + ANYTHING] Rule 3) At least one method must not contain the optional part of the NAME just described in Rule 2. Rule 4) The To method must map to the cartographer property from the noncartographer property Rule 5) The From_ method must map from the cartographer property to the noncartographer property Rule 6) Their signature must match (a) if they map a property that is not an IList property or match (b) or (c) if they map an IList property (a) public void METHODNAME(MapContext mapContext, NONCARTOGRAPHERTYPE noncartographerObject) if METHODNAME == "Match_" + NAME or if nethier of the (b) and (c) conditions belwo are true (b) public void METHODNAME(MapContext mapContext, NONCARTOGRAPHERTYPE noncartographerObject, FROMLISTELEMENTTYPE fromListElement) if Strategy == MappingMethodStrategy.AsFactory (c) public void METHODNAME(MapContext mapContext, NONCARTOGRAPHERTYPE noncartographerObject, FROMLISTELEMENTTYPE fromListElement, TOLISTELEMENTTYPE toListElement) if Strategy == MappingMethodStrategy.AfterFactory or AfterInitialization

TryCast(Object, Type, Object)

Cast a "from" object to a "to" object of a toType Type. If the "to" is directly assignable from the "from" it will be. If it must be cast then reflection will be used to find every possible cast availabe on either type or ancestor of either type The first cast found will be used to cast the source to a new destionation object of destination type. If none of this exists and either the "to" or "from" are an enum then it will attempt to convert between them

Declaration
public static bool TryCast (object from, Type toType, out object to);

The from object to be assigned or cast
